description: From French envisager, from en (“in”) + visage (“visage”); see English visage.

verbs.description: envisage (third-person singular simple present envisages, present participle envisaging, simple past and past participle envisaged)

entries.meaning: To conceive or see something within one's mind; to imagine or envision.
examples: From the very dawn of existence the infant must envisage self, and body acting on self.
